Topic.Title: BAC Share price

Message.Msg: BAC is on ALL the hedge funds pre programmed algos list. It is a day traded Stock in that the price is so cheap compared to other in financial sector. This was and IS being done by hedgies as a planned method of keeping the PPS low to maintain "control" of the PPS. Cheaper the shares, more control they have in shorting,i.e. more shares to short=more control. It is a never ending cycle that will continue until we have a new UPTICK RULE ,..AND a tax on shares shorted. Market at all time highs, BAC up maybe .09. RIDICULOUS!! It is definitely a CONTROLLED STOCK. Very unethical practice being ALLOWED by a weak SEC. We can only hope( pester) Mary Jo White wil/to do something about this. She was sworn in just last Monday. We wish Her good luck in an aggressive posture to clean p this Wall St. B/S!!

Message.Msg: Bank of America (BAC) - Target $15 Bank of America will report earnings on April 17. And if fourth-quarter earnings were any indication, investors should expect the stock to make more 52-week highs as the quarter continues. Bank of America is coming off an excellent fourth quarter, which resulted in $367 million in net income, or 3 cents per share, on revenue of $18.66 billion. While these numbers were not great in first glance, at least not on a sequential basis, but when excluding debt valuation and other impacts, revenue actually arrived at $22.6 billion - beating estimates of $21.03 billion. While the profit drop should be cause for concern, it was not a surprise. The bank recently reached a $10.4 billion settlement with Fannie Mae that chipped away a significant chunk

Message.Title: CCUR Ready to Explode this Afternoon
Message.Msg: CCUR is about to explode this afternoon! It was just announced that Ericsson (ERIC) is buying Microsoft (MSFT)'s Mediaroom IPTV multi-screen business, which allows pay-TV companies to deliver streams of live TV and on demand content to tablets, smartphones, and other mobile devices. ERIC is paying just under $200mm for Mediaroom, which has clients like AT&T Uverse and a total reach of 11mm homes. ERIC's purchase of Mediaroom will instantly give ERIC a 25% multi-screen market share, the highest in this space! CCUR's MediaHawk technology is better than Mediaroom and CCUR is using it to power the multi-screen video delivery platforms of Virgin Media the #1 cable TV company in the UK and Jupiter the #1 cable TV company. CCUR now has a multi-screen reach from Virgin and Jupiter of 6.3mm households or 57% of Mediaroom's reach. If Mediaroom was acquired for just under $200mm, CCUR's MediaHawk is probably worth $100mm, but currently isn't receiving any value! CCUR at $6.98 per share with 8.72mm o/s has a market cap of $60.87mm with $24.6mm in cash and an enterprise value of $36.27mm. After subtracting $15mm, the price CCUR paid to acquire their Media Data Intelligence business, CCUR is only receiving $21.27mm in total value for their real-time and video solutions businesses! CCUR's real-time business has been around since 1967 and provides ultra high performance real-time technology for time-critical simulator applications in the defense and automotive industries. It has 4 of the world's 5 largest defense contractors as clients and annualized revenue of $27.6mm. It's at least worth $25 million, leaving zero value for CCUR's video business! For CCUR to increase in value by $100mm to fairly value its video business, which has $33.89mm in annualized revenue and a 30% share of the video-on-demand (VOD) market, CCUR needs to rise by $11.47 or 164% to $18.45! It could rally to $8 today and break $9 tomorrow!

Message.Title: With a 100% allocation to buy-backs the 11-12 pps range is a blessing and not a curse for long-term share-holders
Message.Msg: the lower the price the more shares are re-purchased and the lower the outstanding shares to pay dividends to in the years ahead. The $5 billion program is not a one-time event. This is ongoing and management will keep doing buy-backs for as long as the pps is under book. 60% of tangible book is a wonderful discount for existing share-holders.

Topic.Title: Hey Obama, what kind of silly "budget" are you proposing?

Message.Msg: True, there is no question that most of the GOP are as intent on spending for their special interests just as most of the left is. It's an equal opportunity issue, but corporations don't vote and the last election disproved the notion that money to non-persons buys elections, so no need to try that argument going forward. But it also proved that the promise of money given away lavishly to individual persons does buy votes, at least temporarily, even though the money and benefit never materializes in the way or amount it was promised. On the right, the goal is to pressure GOP to stop their spending along with blockading that of the left. Would that you made such an argument to the left, since their spending outstrips the right by as much as 3-to-1. But since your point was about military, It would be nice if we could avoid a world war sparked by fatboy in N.Korea trying (and probably failing miserably) to launch a nuke while his people starve and cannibalize each other. It seems the critical issues of the day are always overshadowed by propagandists trying to score points with uninformed, but passionate, voters.

Message.Title: You Have Stumbled Across What You Mistakenly Thought Was A BAC Financial Message Board
Message.Msg: You have stumbled upon what you mistakenly thought was a BAC financial message board. Unfortunately, it is not. It is, however, open for any other topic of discussion you would like, with particular emphasis on the Iraq war, both pro and con, politics in general, as well as religious topics of any kind. Bad poetry and boring travelogs are also welcome, as well as daily diaries of your personal activities and medical history. DO NOT, however, post anything even remotely related to BAC or finance or the markets. Posting any kind of on-topic, BAC or finance or market related posts will get buried by the resident gang #$%$ that has hijacked this forum. Of particualar annoyance lately has been yellowratchimp/gutlesswhatever/shockertoyounumber/blubbering_billy_idiot/the_idiot_foreigner, and its latest incarnation, chimpbushidiot. It has attempted to take over this forum for it's own particular brand of left-wing, anti-American propoganda. The only posters that read its #$%$ are honourmydick/starswithoutbrains/rememberwhenihadalife, and libertydujour. As a matter of fact, they may very well be all the same poster, along with JoeKent, donut/fruitcake/prawndujour, stanluboffanynumberwilldo...(See The Theory of JoeKent and the Gang...) Consider yourself warned, and proceed at your own risk! This board is always, however, good for sarcasm & witticisms... Good luck. Later... SW

Topic.Title: Hey Obama, what kind of silly "budget" are you proposing?

Message.Msg: Military plus ALL govt overhead in all branches including all executive departments (HHS, Ed, Commerce, Ag, etc.) amounts to less than 1/3rd of the total spending, actually. The total is about $1T. SS and M/M are a little more than 2/3rds of the total of some 3.5 trillion. This info is out there on the House website and is updated. And there really is no SS surplus because of our big spenders in both parties. The money that was supposed to be saved was spent. It does not exist. No surplus, no savings, no future for SS. They put a single paper IOU in the box and called that a surplus. And every year they rip up the old one and write a new one. And it's as worthless as its predecessor. That's why I cringe when seniors talk about how much they paid in and are entitled to their SS. It's like, well, you elected people who convinced you to save with the government instead of privately, then they squandered your savings instead of managing it. And now you want those same thieves and fools to rob your grandchildren because you weren't financially responsible with your vote. These people have never figured out what responsibility is, even with age. No wisdom, just older and more misinformed than the year before. And needier and greedier than ever. And the media says these people who built the path to ruin we're now on, these people, must be made somehow immune from the effects of their stupidity and emotionalism and failure to adhere to the basic operating principles of the universe. It's an unfortunate side effect of living on this earth that stupidity kills, and absolute stupidity kills absolutely, and no legislation and no government can or ever will change that immutable fact.
